Reference Guide

Wire Gauge Chart

American Wire Gauge (AWG) to metric conversion chart with current ratings and recommended applications for terminal wire assemblies.

Wire Range
AWG 32-14
0.032mm² - 2.08mm²
Current Range
0.13A - 5.5A
Signal to power applications
Certification
UL Listed
AWM styles available

AWG to Metric Conversion

AWG Cross-Section Diameter Current Rating Application
32 0.032mm² Ø0.2mm 0.13A Ultra-fine pitch (SH/GH series)
30 0.051mm² Ø0.25mm 0.21A Fine pitch (PH/GH series)
28 0.081mm² Ø0.32mm 0.34A Small signal (PH/XH series)
26 0.128mm² Ø0.4mm 0.54A General purpose (PH/XH/EH)
24 0.205mm² Ø0.51mm 0.86A Power applications (XH/EH/VH)
22 0.324mm² Ø0.64mm 1.2A Higher current (EH/VH series)
20 0.519mm² Ø0.81mm 1.7A Power connectors (VH/ZH series)
18 0.823mm² Ø1.02mm 2.5A High current applications
16 1.31mm² Ø1.29mm 3.7A Heavy duty power
14 2.08mm² Ø1.63mm 5.5A Maximum current capacity

Application Guidelines by Connector Series

Micro-Pitch (SH/GH/ZH)

  • ▸ Pitch: 1.0mm - 1.5mm
  • ▸ Recommended: AWG 32-28
  • ▸ Applications: Compact electronics, wearables

Standard Pitch (PH/XH)

  • ▸ Pitch: 2.0mm - 2.5mm
  • ▸ Recommended: AWG 28-24
  • ▸ Applications: Consumer electronics, LED lighting

Power Pitch (EH/VH)

  • ▸ Pitch: 2.5mm - 3.96mm
  • ▸ Recommended: AWG 24-20
  • ▸ Applications: Industrial control, power supply

High Current

  • ▸ Pitch: 3.96mm+
  • ▸ Recommended: AWG 18-14
  • ▸ Applications: Motors, transformers, high power

⚠ Current Rating Notes

  • Current ratings are for single conductor in free air at 20°C
  • Derating required for multiple conductors in bundle or confined spaces
  • Temperature rating of insulation affects current capacity
  • Consult UL standards and specific connector specifications for your application

Need help selecting the right wire gauge for your application?
